Authors: Sara V. Fink, William L. Fink
Title:
A phylogenetic analysis of the genus Stomias, including the
synonymization of Macrostomias.
Abstract:
The eleven currently recognized species in the genus
Stomias form a monophyletic group. Their interrelationships are
hypothesized as follows: brevibarbatus and danae are sister taxa,
forming the sister group to other members of the genus. S. longibarbatus
and pacificus, both formerly placed in Macrostomias, form a sister
lineage to the remaining species. S. colubrinus and lampropeltis are
sister taxa, as are affinis and nebulosus. S. atriventer, boa and
gracilis form a group, with the latter two as sister taxa. The
relationships among the colubrinus, affinis and boa lineages remain
unresolved, since there is conflicting evidence for two resolutions.
Evidence for monophyly of the species is discussed.
